column4: its better that the program loads slower than to have the extra power
thanks for the help, i really dont have time for this :)
that's what powernowd is for. It delivers that extra thurst to CPU when your program consumes more CPU cycles
that's the problem, its almost allways over 800mhz, and the fan goes, more power etc..
so shut it down if you don't want it. sudo "/etc/init.d/powernowd stop"
ok try this instead, "sudo invoke-rc.d powernowd stop"
are you sure you have powernowd installed ?
can you please paste your "/proc/cpuinfo" before and after running a CPU intensive program ?
can we do it a little bit later
